description: The default export, which used to be the v4() method but which was already discouraged in v3.x of this library, has been removed.
Explicitly note that deep imports of the different uuid version functions are deprecated and no longer encouraged and that ECMAScript module named imports should be used instead.
Remove support for generating v3 and v5 UUIDs in Node.js<4.x

Only relevant when used in a browser if that browser does not support Crypto.getRandomValues() (see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Crypto/getRandomValues#browser_compatibility).
You will need to provide the uuidv1 and uuidv4 with the options.rng property as an alternative random number generator. The new function call would look something like uuid({rng: function}), where the function should return an array of 16 byte values (0-255). For security reasons we highly recommend you using an already tested secure number generator (For example, use http://bitwiseshiftleft.github.io/sjcl/doc/sjcl.prng.html).
